about.name: Prague
about.info_text: Prague, often referred to as the 'City of a Hundred Spires,' is the capital of the Czech Republic and a city known for its stunning architecture, rich history, and vibrant culture. Visitors can explore the historic Old Town Square, admire the iconic Charles Bridge, and wander through Prague Castle. The city is also famous for its delicious Czech cuisine and world-renowned beer. Prague offers a magical experience with its cobblestone streets, Gothic cathedrals, and charming atmosphere.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.3 million
Country: Czech Republic
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: Czech
Currency: Czech Koruna (CZK)
about.climate_text: Prague experiences a temperate climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are warm, with average temperatures between 17°C (63°F) and 24°C (75°F). Winters can be cold, with temperatures ranging from -2°C (28°F) to 2°C (36°F).

attractions_card.title: Prague Castle
attractions_card.description: Prague Castle is one of the largest castle complexes in the world, featuring historic buildings, courtyards, and the beautiful St. Vitus Cathedral.

attractions_card.title: Charles Bridge
attractions_card.description: The Charles Bridge is an iconic stone bridge that crosses the Vltava River, adorned with statues, and offering panoramic views of the city.

attractions_card.title: Old Town Square
attractions_card.description: Old Town Square is a historic center featuring the astronomical clock, colorful facades, and vibrant street performances.

attractions_card.title: Astronomical Clock
attractions_card.description: The Prague Astronomical Clock is a medieval marvel that chimes every hour and features an animated show of the 12 apostles.

attractions_card.title: Vysehrad Castle
attractions_card.description: Vysehrad Castle is a historic fortress with stunning views of the city, a beautiful cemetery, and the Church of St. Peter and Paul.

attractions_card.title: Petrin Hill and Tower
attractions_card.description: Petrin Hill offers a peaceful escape with gardens and the Petrin Tower, which resembles the Eiffel Tower and offers panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Dancing House
attractions_card.description: The Dancing House is a modern architectural gem, known for its unique design and artistic flair.

attractions_card.title: Mala Strana (Lesser Town)
attractions_card.description: Mala Strana is a picturesque district with colorful Baroque buildings, charming streets, and the famous Wallenstein Garden.

food_card.title: Trdelnik
food_card.description: Try Trdelnik, a sweet pastry made from rolled dough, grilled over an open flame, and topped with sugar and nuts.

food_card.title: Goulash
food_card.description: Goulash is a hearty Czech stew made with tender chunks of meat and served with bread or dumplings.

food_card.title: Czech Beer
food_card.description: Czech Republic is famous for its beer. Enjoy a glass of Pilsner or other local brews in a traditional pub.

food_card.title: Svickova
food_card.description: Svickova is a traditional Czech dish featuring marinated beef, creamy sauce, and bread dumplings.

food_card.title: Kolache
food_card.description: Kolache is a sweet pastry filled with fruit, cheese, or poppy seeds, often enjoyed for breakfast or dessert.

hotels_card.title: The Grand Mark Prague
hotels_card.description: The Grand Mark Prague is a luxurious hotel offering elegant rooms, a spa, and a central location.

hotels_card.title: Hotel U Prince
hotels_card.description: Hotel U Prince is a boutique hotel located in the heart of Old Town Square, with charming rooms and a rooftop terrace.

hotels_card.title: Aria Hotel Prague
hotels_card.description: Aria Hotel Prague is a music-themed hotel with unique rooms, a rooftop garden, and stunning views of the city.

hotels_card.title: Budget Accommodations
hotels_card.description: Prague offers a range of budget-friendly accommodations, including hostels and guesthouses.

hotels_card.title: Vacation Rentals
hotels_card.description: Consider vacation rentals or apartments for a more home-like stay in Prague's historic neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Vaclav Havel Airport Prague
transport_card.description: Vaclav Havel Airport Prague (PRG) is the main international airport serving the city and offers a wide range of flights.

transport_card.title: Trams and Metro
transport_card.description: Prague's tram and metro system provides convenient and affordable transportation throughout the city.

transport_card.title: Charles Bridge
transport_card.description: Walk across the historic Charles Bridge, which is a picturesque way to explore the city center on foot.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Prague and can be a convenient way to reach your destination.

transport_card.title: Walking
transport_card.description: Walking is a fantastic way to experience the charm of Prague's historic streets and landmarks.
